Extrude depth towards normal: 0.75 - Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.0 - Sketch scale: 0.3513 - Operation: Create a new solid body **Measurements**: The final shape has the following dimensions: - Length: 0.3513 - Width: 0.75 - Height: 0.3513 **Intermediate Part 2** **Shape**: A 3D model of a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a flat side perpendicular to the sloped side of Part 1. *Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties:* - prompt: <description>**Construct a Cylindrical Object with a Rectangular Protrusion** **Part 1: Cylindrical Object** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0832, 0.105, 0.0] Create the 2D sketch for this part on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. The sketch should contain a single face (face\\_1) and loop (loop\\_1). On face\\_1, create a circle (circle\\_1) using the following parameters: - Center: [0.3214, 0.3214] - Radius: 0.3214 After creating the 2D sketch, scale it using the scaling parameter: sketch\\_scale = 0.6429 Transform the 2D sketch into 3D using the following Euler angles and translation vector: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] Extrude the scaled and transformed 2D sketch along the normal direction with the following properties: - Extrude Depth Towards Normal: 0.75 - Extrude Depth Opposite Normal: 0.0 - Sketch Scale: 0.6429 - Operation: New Body Feature **Part 2: Rectangular Protrusion** Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.6429, 0.0] Create a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system. The sketch should contain a single face (face\\_1) and loop (loop\\_1). On face\\_1, create the following lines (line\\_1 to line\\_4) to form a rectangle: - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.2143, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.2143, 0.0], End Point [0.2143, 0.2143] - Line 3: Start Point [0.2143, 0.2143], End Point [0.0, 0.2143] - Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.2143], End Point [0.0, 0.0] After creating the 2D sketch, scale it using the scaling parameter: sketch\\_scale = 0.2143 Transform the 2D sketch into 3D using the following Euler angles and translation vector: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] Extrude the scaled and transformed 2D sketch along the normal direction with the following properties: - Extrude Depth Towards Normal: 0.6429 - Extrude Depth Opposite Normal: 0.0 - Sketch Scale: 0.2143 - Operation: Join Feature The first two parts are constructed with the given dimensions and operations. Continue generating the remaining parts by following the same process. Make sure to use the correct coordinate systems, sketches, scaling parameters, transformations, and extrusions as specified in the CAD Assembly JSON.</description>

prompt: <description>**Part 1 Instructions:** **Construct a rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top and bottom. The sides are parallel and the edges are straight. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units by 3 units by 4 units.** **Step 1:** Start by creating a new coordinate system with the following Euler angles: - Roll: 0.0 degrees - Pitch: 0.0 degrees - Yaw: -90.0 degrees And the following translation vector: - X: 0.0 - Y: 0.3333 - Z: 0.0 **Step 2:** Create the first face of the sketch by drawing a polyline with the following vertices in order: - Point 1: (0.0, 0.0) - Point 2: (0.75, 0.0) - Point 3: (0.75, 0.4444) - Point 4: (0.6667, 0.4444) - Point 5: (0.6667, 0.5) - Point 6: (0.5, 0.5) - Point 7: (0.5, 0.4444) - Point 8: (0.4167, 0.4444) - Point 9: (0.4167, 0.2778) - Point 10: (0.0, 0.2778) **Step 3:** Close the loop by connecting the final point to the starting point (0.0, 0.0). This will create the bottom face of the prism. **Step 4:** Create a second face of the sketch by drawing a rectangle with the following vertices: - Point 1: (0.5, 0.2778) - Point 2: (0.6667, 0.2778) - Point 3: (0.6667, 0.3889) - Point 4: (0.5, 0.3889) **Step 5:** Close the loop by connecting the final point to the starting point (0.5, 0.2778). This will create the tapered top of the prism. **Step 6:** Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75. This will adjust the width of the prism to match the desired dimension. **Step 7:** Extrude the sketch along the normal direction by a distance of 0.3333 units. **Step 8:** Specify the operation as creating a new solid body, without using the specific term "NewBodyFeatureOperation". This will complete the first part of the CAD assembly.</description>
